alert.note: Alert for Grand (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 22 at 3:14PM MDT until August 22 at 6:15PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: The National Weather Service in Denver has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Northeastern Grand County in north central Colorado... * Until 615 PM MDT. * At 314 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, gulches, roads, and poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Granby, Hot Sulphur Springs and Grand Lake. This includes the following additional locations... Columbine Lake, rising water in the Colorado River along River Rd, Lower Stillwater Creek, Stillwater Pass, Upper Willow Creek Valley, Middle Willow Creek Valley, Lower Willow Creek Valley, Drowsy Water Ranch, Elk Mountain, Remote East Troublesome Headwaters, East Troublesome Valley and Upper Corral Creek Valley. This includes the following streams and drainages... Willow Creek, Soda Creek, Pole Creek, Buffalo Creek, Corral Creek, Round Creek, Troublesome Creek, Kinney Creek, East Branch Willow Creek, Trail Creek, Sheep Creek, Drowsy Water Creek, Colorado River, Cabin Creek, Gardiner Creek, Monument Creek, Smith Creek, Onahu Creek, East Fork Troublesome Creek, North Fork Cabin Creek, Trout Creek, Mc Queary Creek, Wheatley Creek, Ethel Creek, Ranger Creek, Gold Run, Illinois River, Fraser River, Middle Fork Creek and Jones Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Move to higher ground now. Act quickly to protect your life. Heavy Rainfall will cause flash flooding of small creeks, streams, and ditches in the East Troublesome burn area. Rock slides or debris flows can also be expected across rural roads.
